'' ~-This page is reserved for information that is specific to themes to be made by community members.-~ ''

=== Goal ===

** '''Enhance the user experience of Ubuntu by creating high quality alternate themes which are available from the repositories.'''

==== Objectives ====

  1. ''Encourage the Artwork community to create submissions by offering to showcase their best effort which targets the current development release of Ubuntu.''
** ''Achieve the highest possible quality by mentoring artists as needed.''
** ''Support the effort of the larger community by meeting published milestones and deadlines.''

=== Goal ===

** '''Advocate the use of Open Source Artistic Tools'''

==== Objectives ====

  1. ''Encourage artists to use open source artistic tools available from the Ubuntu repositories.''
** ''Mentor artists in the use of desired tools.''
** ''Create wiki pages and how-to's as needed.''
** ''Engage the communities which support desired tools by submitting bug reports and offering suggestions for improvement.''

=== Guidelines for Inclusion ===

 1. Licensed to permit distribution and editing. Preferred licenses are the latest <nowiki>[[http://www.gnu.de/documents/lgpl-3.0.de.html|LGPL]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/|CC-BY-SA]]</nowiki>.
* The desired result must be package-able
* The submission must be unique
* Author or delegate must agree to maintain and support the submission for the duration of the cycle (~6 months)
* Submissions must be developed by the Artwork team or have a significant Artwork team contribution. Upstream effort will need explicit collaboration/contact with the original author.

=== Packages ===
==== Community-themes ====

Showcase and package the two best submissions per category as 'community-themes'. Categories include but are not limited to:
** Desktop GTK & Metacity Themes
** Desktop Background Images
** Desktop Sound Themes
** Desktop Icon Themes
** Usplash Boot Themes

==== Community-themes-extras ====

If desired, package additional submissions which meet the criteria for inclusion as 'community-themes-extras'.
